org.gvsig.fmap.geometries.iso
Interface AbstractGeometry

All Known Subinterfaces:
AbstractGeometryPrimitive, CompositeCurve, CompositeSolid, CompositeSurface, Curve, GeometricComplex, IGeometry, IGeometry3D, IGeometryM, MultiCurve, MultiGeometry, MultiPoint, MultiSolid, MultiSurface, OrientableCurve, OrientablePrimitive, OrientableSurface, Point, Solid, Surface
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractGeometry, FArc2D, FCircle2D, FCurve, FEllipse2D, FGeometry, FGeometryCollection, FGeometryM, FMultiPoint2D, FMultipoint3D, FMultiPolygon2D, FMultiPolyline2D, FMultiSolid, FNullGeometry, FOrientablePolygon2D, FOrientablePolyline2D, FOrientablePrimitive2D, FPoint2D, FPoint2DM, FPoint3D, FPolygon2D, FPolygon2DM, FPolygon3D, FPolyline2D, FPolyline2DM, FPolyline3D, FPolyline3DM, FSolid, FSpline2D, FTriangle, Gt2Geometry
public interface AbstractGeometry

This interface must to be implemented by all the geometries. It contains methods that has been created because of they are on the ISO 19107 and others that has been inherited because of the previous gvSIG versions.

Author:
Jorge Piera Llodrá (jorge.piera@iver.es)
See Also:
http://www.iso.org/iso/iso_catalogue/catalogue_tc/catalogue_detail.htm?csnumber=32554, http://www.iso.org/iso/iso_catalogue/catalogue_tc/catalogue_detail.htm?csnumber=26012

getId

java.lang.String getId()
This method returns the geometry identifier just as is described on the ISO 10136.

This method returns the geometry coordinates reference system just as is described on the ISO 10136.

Returns:
the projection

This method has been created because of the ISO 19107

transform

AbstractGeometry transform(IProjection newProjection)
This method has been created because of the ISO 19107. It returns a cloned geometry in the new SRS

Parameters:
newProjection - The new projection
Returns:
the boundary that encloses the geometry
